page.title: 17TREFONEN PLAYING FIELD
page.content:
{TREFONEN PLAYING FIELD}
Trefonen playing field,which is nicknamed by the local children "THE PIT",used to be an old coal mine and you can still see the remains of it hiding under the brambles and the long grass.The land was once glebe land,which is land that is owned by the church.It is now used as a sports field where lots of activities take place such as football,cricket, rounders and skittles.The local school has use of it.The village playing field was bought buy Oswestry borough council, in 1978.The council are responsible for the up keep of the field and nothing can be built on the field without permission.
